title: "ICEBERG" sans..
content:
Can anyone help me id this one?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001im_/http:/typophile.com/files/iceberg.jpg)

 [‹ babies font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/typophile.com/node/19213 "Go to previous forum topic") [Hebrew font--what is this font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/typophile.com/node/19282 "Go to next forum topic")
author: henand

comments.content: Some similar faces are [Eric Olson](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Eric%252BOlson)’s [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/charregular.html), [Jonathan Hoefler](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jonathan%252BHoefler) and [Tobias Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tobias%252BFrere-Jones)’ [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/more07.html), [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mark%252BSimonson)’s [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224001/http:/ms-studio.com/FontSales/proximanova.html), but none have the seriffed capital “I”.
Thanks! I thinks Gotham is the closest one for this purpose...
I think that but for the “I” it most looks like Sackers Gothic slightly squooshed.
